intro: Kochia scleroptera, commonly known as burning bush, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its vibrant red, orange, or purple foliage that becomes more pronounced in the fall. The plant produces small, green flowers that develop into dry, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Kochia scleroptera is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking seasonal color changes. It is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
